titles.ar: بَابُ الرَّجُلِ يُسْلِمُ فَيَحُجُّ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَخْتَتِنَ
titles.en: Chapter 43 – The man becomes a Muslim, so he performs Hajj before he is circumcised

titles.ar: بَابُ الْمَرْأَةِ يَمْنَعُهَا زَوْجُهَا مِنْ حَجَّةِ الْإِسْلَامِ
titles.en: Chapter 44 – The woman who is forbidden by her husband from performing the Hajj of Al-Islam

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ يُسْتَحَبُّ لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَكُونَ مُتَهَيِّئاً لِلْحَجِّ فِي كُلِّ وَقْتٍ
titles.en: Chapter 42 – It is recommended for the man that he happens to be prepared for the Hajj at all times

titles.ar: بَابُ الرَّجُلِ يُسْلِمُ فَيَحُجُّ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَخْتَتِنَ
titles.en: Chapter 43 – The man becomes a Muslim, so he performs Hajj before he is circumcised

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/171)
text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يُسْلِمُ فَيُرِيدُ أَنْ يَحُجَّ وَ قَدْ حَضَرَ الْحَجُّ أَ يَحُجُّ أَوْ يَخْتَتِنُ قَالَ لَا يَحُجُّ حَتَّى يَخْتَتِنَ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan, from Ibrahim Bin Maymoun,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding the man who became a Muslim, so he intended to perform Hajj, and the (season) for the Hajj had presented itself, should he perform Hajj or should he be circumcised?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should not perform Hajj until he is circumcised’.
en.sarwar: 1. Abu Ali al-Ash’ariy has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan from Ibrahim ibn Maymun who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who becomes a Muslim and wants to perform al-Hajj and it is time for al-Hajj, if he performs al-Hajj or circumcision. He (the Imam) said, ‘He must not perform al-Hajj until he is circumcised.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/172)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ أَنْ تَطُوفَ الْمَرْأَةُ غَيْرَ الْمَخْفُوضَةِ فَأَمَّا الرَّجُلُ فَلَا يَطُوفُ إِلَّا وَ هُوَ مُخْتَتِنٌ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Hareyz,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is no problem if the woman circumambulates without having been circumcised, but as for the man, so he should not circumambulate unless he is circumcised’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘It is not harmful if a woman who is not Makhfudah (circumcised) performs Tawaf, but a man must not perform Tawaf until he is circumcised.’”
